subject: Nutrition
title: Calories for Athletes
description: A short lesson to help you apply Calories for Athletes.

hook.text: Michael Phelps ate 12,000 calories daily during Olympic training. Most athletes need far less than that.

buildup.text: Energy needs depend on sport, body size, training volume, and intensity. A gymnast and rower differ vastly.

discovery.text: Endurance athletes can burn 3,000 to 5,000 calories in a single heavy training session.

twist.text: Undereating is more common than overeating among athletes. Chronic deficit causes injury and illness.

climax.text: Fueling to support trainingâ€”not restricting to lose weightâ€”is the biggest challenge in sports nutrition.

punchline.text: Athletes fail more from underfueling than overeating.
